29.06.text:
Welcome to Fieldsports Britain. Coming up
we are here in Germany for sparkly new bullets

34.71.text:
and shiny new guns, the European Kit Show.
A spot of the old Vorsprüng durch Technik.

40.41.text:
We have our regulars, we have News Stump,
we have Hunting Youtube. First the pigeon

45.89.text:
punisher, the rat ravisher, the high priest
of the home counties, it is Roy Lupton.

51.02.text:
Ooops shall we try again, that's better - We
may mock, but you can't blame the boy, it's

59.75.text:
been a while since we were out with a centre
fire rifle. However, this morning we can dust

64.86.text:
off the cobwebs and carpe diem - seize the
day.

69.67.text:
What we are looking for this morning, if we
can is, if we can find a yearling doe, not

74.60.text:
overly keen on shooting mature animals at
this time of the year just purely and simply

78.75.text:
for the fact that the foetuses at this time
of the year tend to be getting quite large.

83.39.text:
The other thing that we will be looking for
this morning is that we are going to try and

85.91.text:
account for a few foxes. We have got a lot
of foxes back on this ground and again because

90.12.text:
of the weather we have just not been able
to keep up with them

93.05.text:
Gary and Roy scan for fallow but there's nothing
where he'd hoped they might rest up.

97.58.text:
So, with the coast clear and a few other areas
to hit after this one, Roy doesn't mind potentially

103.11.text:
upsetting the neighbours with some fox calling,
once he's changed to a lighter bullet.

108.71.text:
What I am doing is taking out the 90 grains
and putting in, I think they are 55 those

118.82.text:
ones. With the Norma ammunition it does group
quite well. So the 90's at a distance you

126.39.text:
just to come up a few clicks from the scope,
but as long as you know exactly what rounds

134.12.text:
you have chambered then you know exactly where
to shoot with them, but I just prefer a slightly

139.13.text:
lighter round for the foxes. Just quicker
extraction. There is one, there is one.

151.22.text:
Roy lights the fuse and within a matter of
seconds spots a fox charging towards us- unfortuantely

156.61.text:
David doesn't. Even though it's there...and
oh look, there it is in the frame ...What

159.25.text:
are doing man??? Frustratingly for Roy David
just can't make it out. I must just add at

164.83.text:
this point that things do improve as the morning
progresses.

168.70.text:
As we re-group Gary tells us that he spotted
deer during the calling - David's bad eye

173.78.text:
sight might have actually done us a favour.
As we get closer we bounce a young doe.

181.16.text:
We stalk slowly down the hill. We will go
slowly down this way and we will get the other

188.01.text:
side of this thicket and then we will see
if they trickle back out and then we can shoot

194.66.text:
We split up to see if either one of them can
get onto her. But, in the meantime, up pops

199.12.text:
Roy's buck. Nervously he checks Gary remembered
it was just young does today.

207.05.text: I don't want him getting shot.

215.45.text:
As we watch the young doe come back into sight,
Roy takes his chance. She leaps forward and

230.07.text: runs - typical of a heart shot.

233.81.text:
We just got that young fallow over there and
I am pleased that we took her because I think

242.77.text:
she was actually on her own that one and when
you have got a deer like that in an area like

246.89.text:
this where we have got so many dog walkers,
they are the ones that tend to get caught

250.06.text:
against the fences or pushed up against the
fences and attacked. She did run unfortunately,

254.77.text:
if you can drop them on the stop it is a lot
nicer, but obviously she has been quite revved

259.43.text: up because we have moved her once or twice.

262.74.text:
Roy heads to the spot where the deer was shot
- he does this as a matter of course to build

267.23.text:
up a forensic picture. He interprets the signs
as it might prove useful the next ttime, when

272.57.text: the deer doesn't fall within view.

274.38.text:
So we have got perfect blood here where the
outshot is, so this is where the bullet struck

279.66.text:
and we have got a nice blood trail leading
off there and obviously the disturbance in

283.45.text:
the leaves is where she ran. 20 yards on from
the initial outspot and then all of a sudden

290.74.text:
the blood really is pumping out. So actually
as she is running it is pumping out of her

295.15.text:
body so the motion of her running is causing
compression and causing the heart to pump

300.72.text:
and so we are really getting some serious
outbursts of blood here and if you look further

305.37.text:
up on this fence line it has sprayed all the
way up here and along as if somebody has opened

312.54.text:
a tap. You can see her tracks here and you
can see that she was really struggling and

318.88.text:
she was running and trying to push out. So
the toes have gone in there pushing back where

323.82.text:
she is struggling here to stand up. So again
it is always a good sign to look out for if

328.73.text:
you have got nothing else to go on and she
has just dropped over there. If you look where

336.44.text: she was standing she was slightly

338.18.text:
quartering away. So we have gone in there
and should have hit the heart perfectly and

345.23.text: out just on the back end of the shoulder there.

349.12.text:
The young doe looks healthy - and the shot
has done exactly as the deer's reaction suggests.

355.31.text:
So we have completely obliterated and bifurcated
the top of the heart and the base of the lungs

362.64.text:
there. She was a strong little girl and amazingly
and when you look at the fat on the internal

372.12.text:
organs there she was doing incredibly well.
All around her kidneys there, an amazing amount

376.65.text:
of fat. So she hasn't been doing badly. Quite
interesting to see what she has been eating.

381.02.text:
And again mainly grazing, what you would expect.
There are a few bits of nuts and whatever

397.97.text:
else in there. I think that is really why
they have done so well this year. There was

402.32.text:
just so much natural food around this winter.
They have been foraging very well on the beech

407.01.text:
nuts and on the acorns and the chestnuts and
what have you. It is not surprising they are

411.91.text:
doing quite well and carrying that much fat
coming out of winter. It hasn't really been

419.23.text:
With some vension for the freezer, it's now
over to Gary to try his luck.

422.31.text:
If you want to shoot off the bipods you are
going to have to stalk up there. Yes stalk

428.58.text: up there and see what you can do.

429.28.text:
We spot a group of deer on the other side
of the estate - but Gary isn't happy with

432.93.text:
the shot and, when there's another chance,
they're on the neighbours ground.

438.92.text:
The direction we've come in brings us to a
nice area for another fox call...

443.02.text:
This time Roy sticks Gary with David on the
opposite side of the valley. He's going to

447.57.text:
call from behind a tree stump with the shotgun.
If a fox comes and stops Gary is in a better

452.98.text: position to get a shot with the rifle.

455.20.text:
Roy is mic'd up so can flag up if he's sees
anything.

476.52.text:
And off we go - Roy spots a fox ...David picks
it up but then loses it. Roy perserveres but

477.65.text:
after 5 mins is about to give up - he then
hears magpies behind Gary and David - so he

482.46.text:
resumes calling - Incredibly a fox runs straight
past Gary and David. Roy has spotted it but

504.90.text:
Oh my God. I am still shaking. We heard the
magpies kicking off right behind where the

525.13.text:
camera was so I changed back the call again
and went back to a lighter call because it

529.70.text:
sounded like a fox was coming back through
the brambles. Then amazingly the fox passed

534.10.text:
in between the camera and where I was tucked
up here, followed it all the way into here.

538.85.text:
Then I couldn't shoot and had to wait for
it to come across and it was difficult waiting

544.96.text:
because she was coming, coming, coming and
she got to about four or five yards. So she

549.46.text:
stopped 
just about there. Then I had to show myself
around the log and she went and I just shot

559.98.text: her as she went off there.

562.02.text:
Daylight foxing is fantastic when it works
and frustrating when it doesn't but we've

565.94.text:
never had a case where a fox has been so intent
on finding what's making the distress call

570.92.text:
that she would run straight past two people,
one lying down, the other kneeling.

575.75.text:
And she ran what two yards past you? Maximum.
Gary said he felt the whoosh as she ran past.

580.88.text:
She came tearing past, luckily they were just
the right side of the wind otherwise it would

585.78.text:
have been game over. It is amazing, if the
fox is not directly looking in the direction

591.18.text:
of the squeak what you can get away with.
So it has just come tearing past all the way

595.38.text:
along here as I say initially I couldn't take
the shot because she was in direct line of

600.72.text:
fire of Gary and David. So I had to wait for
her to come across here and wait until she

605.63.text:
was here to take the shot. Superb response
very happy with that one.

610.34.text:
Once again Mr Lupton conjures up some quality
fieldsport and fieldcraft. Who mentioned anything

616.01.text:
about him losing his mojo (cough cough) - first
class service every time, signed for, postage

622.57.text: paid and slap down on the mat.

626.92.text:
What a star. Now for something less shiny.
It is David on the Fieldsports Channel News

640.45.text:
David Cameron wants Tony Blair's ban on hunting
with dogs amended to allow… hunting with

645.31.text:
dogs. The British prime minister is to allow
a vote in the House of Commons on proposals

649.98.text:
by Welsh hill farmers to allow them to use
hounds to control foxes during the lambing

655.42.text:
The Countryside Alliance is still pushing
for a full repeal of the law. And this week

659.67.text:
the courts are expected to throw out yet another
case brought with ‘video evidence' from

665.07.text:
League Against Cruel Sports vigilantes. This
time against two masters of the Devon & Somerset

672.91.text:
Crufts took place at the weekend - and there
are no places for Labradors. A standard poodle

678.33.text:
wins the overall prize, a rehomed seven-year-old
German wirehaired pointer takes the trophy

683.29.text:
in the BASC Gamekeepers' Classes, and the
winner of the whole gundog group is an American

688.19.text:
cocker spaniel. Here is the winning bitch,
Pearl, with owner Susan Crummey from Buckinghamshire.

694.69.text:
A major new clay competition in Dubai with
an uber prize pot has been won by an American.

701.81.text:
The 2014 Nad Al Sheba Sporting Clay Shooting
Championship saw a good showing from the UK

707.63.text:
with Sean Bramley and Christopher Broomfield
taking fourth and fifth places, and George

711.77.text:
Digweed in seventh, as this video from English
SportingClays.co.uk shows. Gebben Miles of

721.78.text:
We now know how the $350,000 raised by an
auction to shoot a black rhino will be spent.

728.93.text:
Namibia Ministry of Environment and Tourism
officials say the funds from the Dallas Safari

733.21.text:
Club auction will be used for law enforcement
training, patrol vehicles and a national intelligence

738.56.text:
system crucial for protecting rhino populations
from criminal poaching. A petition by anti-hunting

744.19.text:
groups, however, could block the additional
conservation funding.

748.58.text:
Meanwhile Indonesia has come up with a novel
anti-poaching initiative. Its highest Islamic

753.59.text:
body has issued a fatwa declaring that the
hunting and trading of endangered species

760.46.text:
And finally, pity the poor deer in this film
from the States. Two whitetail bucks locked

766.30.text:
while fighting. The larger of the two was
eaten by coyotes while the other was alive.

770.97.text:
A local man had to use a wood saw to cut a
few tines off both deer until the live one

776.16.text:
was free. But all the time he was talking
to the live deer thinking that that would

777.51.text:
You are now up to date with Fieldsports Channel
News. Stalking the stories. Fishing for facts.

788.86.text:
Thank you David. Now let's see what you have
been up to. It is Hallo Charlie.

796.51.text:
Here is the what the world has been up to
this week.

799.68.text:
Hallo Charlie. Not foxing or deer stalking
or even fishing. Out here in the Peak District

805.79.text:
enjoying the good old mother nature at its
finest.

808.61.text:
Hallo Charlie. We are at IWA 2014 in Nurnberg
with Pete Carr. These guys have just subscribed

817.10.text: to the Shooting Show, Shooting Show.

820.07.text:
Hallo Charlie. Jamie here again. Just had
a good night lamping in rural Hertfordshire

827.27.text: and a fox. A good day.

831.66.text: Hallo Charlie. That will really annoy him.

835.71.text:
Send us your own Hallo Charlie. Film yourself
on your mobile phone and just a sentence saying

838.66.text:
Hallo Charlie, who you are and what you are
up to. Then share it or email it via Youtube,

843.18.text:
Facebook, Dropbox or Yousendit, Younameit
to Charlie@fieldsportschannel.tv

848.33.text:
Thank you for those. Please keep sending them
in.

850.74.text:
Now we are in Nurnberg to look at sparkly
new kit from 17's to 416's. Follow me inside.

865.28.text:
The show is a chance for the big boys to flex
their muscles...either by size or with eye

872.96.text:
Sauer didn't let the side down with this industrial
Frankenstein 202 plus a Ghengis Khan special.

881.40.text:
Maybe a certain Mr Putin will open his chequebook
for that one. And maybe it's time for the

886.31.text:
predator version for 2015- not sure if the
wife will like that next to the bird table.

895.79.text:
Anyway, ....anyone who is anyone is here.
Umarex had a very classy stand with shooting

906.61.text:
range, and if you weren't bowled over by the
size of the stand there was always the screens.

912.14.text:
Once again boar is best and there were plenty
of videos - Prince Albrecht, Europe's "hog

918.26.text:
god" showing all how to rid the world of running
boar - thanks to Aimpoint of course.

924.15.text: And here's one we prepared earlier....

926.51.text:
This is your mimesis. This is a wild boar.
This is what you have got to film. Alright?

933.48.text: Nod once for yes. Very good.

935.88.text:
Maybe in 2014 David will finally deliver the
boar shooting film he dreams of. Take heart,

941.96.text:
it doesn't always have to be big game, it
could fruit or candles or dinky toys. Here's

947.58.text:
some slo mo air rifle action from the likes
of Gamo and BSA.

957.16.text:
We'd prefer to see it on the real thing but
what's not to like about slow-mo on household

962.42.text:
We're back at the range facilities where they
make the RWS ammunition. It gives the world's

968.69.text:
journalists a chance to play with new stuff
and pick up some freebies - the blaggers.

974.06.text:
Harkila, Zeiss, Mauser, Sauer, Blaser and
English gunmaker John Rigby are supporting

979.13.text:
the day with, of course, RWS being ‘mine
host'.

986.99.text:
This year was a relaxed affair with more play
than work. Hunting clothing catwalks are always

992.20.text:
an odd affair but this is not about looks
- this is about practicallity - or is it,

998.57.text:
The job start off with what do we need. Do
we need a jacket for stalking and then we

1003.48.text:
make sure that everything is for stalking
and then at the end of the very last design

1009.05.text:
meeting, at the end we can add on maybe a
colourful zip that is hidden, we could make

1014.78.text:
an inner pocket that is a different colour
and where men might stop with the functionality

1020.89.text:
and say now it works that is good women they
take the next step and say we want it to look

1026.60.text:
Let's head to the range and look at the microscopic
then the monolithic. First RWS is launching

1032.27.text:
2 new pellets the heavy weight Power Bolt
- and the eco friendly Hypermatch. They are

1037.96.text:
related but oh so different in a Danny deVito
/ Arnie Schwarzenegger ‘Twins' kind of way.

1043.75.text:
Power Bolt from RWS is definitely the heaviest
airgun pellet we ever made and I guess in

1050.48.text:
calibre 5.5 it is definitely the heaviest
airgun pellet in the world. So we have 1.6g

1056.48.text:
in calibre 5.5 so this is really, really heavy.
It is for hunting, for pest control and of

1064.21.text:
course it can go in the field having fun with
it. And shooting on gelatine blocks it goes

1074.92.text:
really deeply to 20cm it is much energy in
the target.

1083.57.text:
On hand to help test these pellets are a couple
of very nice Steyr air rifles - so do you

1089.76.text:
fancy competing in the Olympics or having
pigeon for tea?

1092.72.text:
I imagine we are looking at the Ferrari of
airguns is that right.

1097.26.text:
Yes that is right that is the top level air
rifle and it is brand new and it is made to

1103.54.text:
win Olympic games and world championships
now.

1107.00.text:
The green debate is not going anywhere and
the big manufacturers are pushing ahead with

1111.00.text:
all their pellets and cartridges. RWS has
a new green hunting round.

1116.38.text:
Well hit sense for high impact technologies.
The hit card is a new bullet concept that

1123.34.text:
addresses hunters that want to have a deep
penetration even when heavy bones are hit

1128.09.text:
they want to have a clean cavity, no fragments,
clean meat 100% clean meat usage and a perfect

1136.20.text: Sounds like a bullet for difficult shots.

1138.11.text:
Yes that is what it is all about. We address
our target groups we go the extra mile when

1144.01.text:
it gets difficult then RWS has a perfect solution
for it.

1147.32.text:
From the fruit tea drinking Hypermatch to
the double espresso - The Rigby "buffalo-flooring"

1152.61.text:
big game rifle - It throws a .416 bullet down
range... very loudly. This brand has been

1162.21.text:
reignited thanks to re-establishing a historic
British-German relationship.

1167.23.text:
While Rigbys was founded in 1775, third oldest
gunmakers in the world, spent 20 years in

1172.43.text:
America, now come back to London. I'm the
managing director and we've put together the

1176.64.text:
old Rigby team, we have ten people working
for us and we are making beautiful rifles

1180.30.text:
How are you making those beautiful rifles.
One of the problems Rigbys had was it it was

1184.20.text: extremely expensive to buy a Rigby rifle.

1185.77.text:
Absolutely, if you look back in the 1924 catalogue
the rifles were costing Ł47 which in todays

1191.06.text:
money is onlyŁ7000, so this idea of Ł25000
rifles does not really work. What we have

1196.72.text:
been able to do working again with Mauser
as Rigbys did 1oo years ago is to produce

1200.56.text:
this big game rifle which is retailing in
the UK for just over Ł7000 which is quite

1207.56.text:
Back to the show - and Zeiss has a wealth
of new kit to talk about. In particular is

1212.59.text:
the replacement for the incredibly successful
Duralyt.

1215.56.text:
Duralyt is now called conquest DL so part
of the conquest line DL stands for durable

1221.71.text:
and light and it's coming in the new Zeiss
design so we step back from the grey of the

1227.28.text:
Duralyt as you know it and we realise the
company black design where we low in contour

1233.65.text:
and very elegant in shape and this products
got features like lototec for example, so

1239.26.text:
you've got a perfect view even if its snowing
or raining. And at a price of Ł1000 to Ł1500

1247.17.text:
euro we realised a product with a polo drop
compensator.

1252.27.text:
The A as you know it from Zeiss so this is
an option for the fantastic scope. All in

1258.77.text:
all I would say that with these conquest DL
its hard to find something on the market which

1265.18.text:
offers more brand, more design, more features
than the Conquest DL rifle scopes.

1271.75.text:
The DL is not the only new launch from Zeiss.
There are also new models of the Conquest

1277.04.text:
HD binoculars, the top-end lightweight Victory
HT binos and the V8 SuperZoom scope we covered

1284.57.text:
It takes me hours to look as shabby as this.
Let's go and talk to a clothing professional.

1291.08.text:
Bent Rasmussen is the chief executive of sister
clothing companies Harkila and Seeland. He

1296.46.text:
knows clothes - but does he really? I mean
- he says he has taken tweed and made it better

1304.71.text:
So like a tweed jacket made with gortex . Has
been sorted out with gortex and the combination

1310.60.text:
of a certain tweed with a certain breathability
combined with the laminate from gortex has

1317.13.text:
created for us and for the market a totally
new product

1320.00.text:
Techology is re-inventing the old but what
does Bent think we will be talking about in

1325.38.text:
We know that hunters are moving. They are
exploring new hunting markets, new hunting

1330.01.text:
situations and that all creates a demand for
gear and for clothing for that type of market.

1338.10.text:
We might see a heavy down jacket like we have
for expedition. If we start hunting in very

1344.54.text:
cold areas like Russia which is one of our
new markets.

1348.29.text:
We've covered lots of ground - sharing the
love. We've had a look at air rifles, scopes,

1352.94.text:
clothes, so we finish with a new shotgun and
Browning's new 20 guage.

1356.75.text:
This is probably the biggest launch we've
got. It's the 75 now in 20 gauge which has

1361.33.text:
been a long time coming, we've finally now
got it and you'll be pleased to know we've

1364.91.text:
now got the 20 gauge in 2 options so the top
version you can see is what we call the UK

1370.51.text:
Game version. This features a Prince of Wales
stock and a parallel game fore end. Or this

1375.99.text:
standard sort of Browning specification that
you would be familiar with the snable for

1379.93.text:
end and the pistol grip. Both fantastic performing
guns. We just do the 32 inch version in the

1388.75.text: But it's not just about Brownings, what else?

1392.30.text:
Well we've got a lovely launch again this
year in the Miraku range, MK60 grade 5 which

1396.99.text:
in itself is a tremendous game gun, lovely
hand finished engraving and we can do these

1402.35.text:
with consecutive numbers, numbered 1 and 2
in a leather case. You can buy all that for

1407.65.text:
around Ł5000 which is very good value for
money.

1411.75.text:
There you have it. The European guntrade is
alive and kicking with loads of stuff to tempt

1416.79.text: you. And all for you to enjoy!

1419.64.text:
Right that's the world of hunting kit in Nurnberg,
let's look at the wider world of hunting and

1424.35.text: shooting on YouTube. It is Hunting YouTube.

1432.11.text:
This is Hunting YouTube, which aims to show
the best hunting and shooting videos that

1436.65.text:
We start with America. 'Say Cheese,' says
WorldHuntingGroup about this film which shows

1441.45.text:
an unsuspecting coyote on the trail of a deer
fawn walking straight into a bowhunter on

1447.41.text:
Next up is a quail shoot enjoyed by a team
of lady guns. They are on the Double D Quail

1454.36.text:
And here's a reminder of the 2013-2014 duck
and goose season in the USA which was, American

1459.46.text:
waterfowlers claim, one to remember. Much
of the USA has been plagued by above normal

1464.21.text:
temperatures over the past couple years leading
to a poor duck migration. This year, numerous

1469.21.text:
arctic cold fronts produced an incredible
season for much of the country. Waterfowl

1473.76.text:
made it further south than they have for a
number of years.

1476.84.text:
Now driven hunting on the Continent. Big game
hunting in a French Castle has Wild French

1481.63.text:
Hunter enjoying roe deer, goat, deer and wild
boar with dubious use of English but bags

1487.56.text:
Winter hunting in Poland - the direct translation
- is another grand day out with not much in

1492.08.text:
the way of foreign language and plenty of
shooting.

1494.82.text:
Last three are British. Falconry Edinburgh
gets some good flights in this compilation

1498.76.text:
of clips showing their hawks hunting during
the season.

1501.85.text:
At the other end of the country, KernowVerminControl
is shooting squirrels with fascinating voice-over

1506.89.text:
but it would be nice to see some different
camera angles. My eyes started to water after

1511.88.text:
a while, searching for the squirrel I am not
sure was there. Still - worth a watch.

1516.53.text:
And finally, if you know or are related to
BumblefootFilms, then you should know he has

1521.29.text:
gone mad and may need help. Here is his review
of a CZ rifle. It is the first rifle review

1527.05.text:
I have laughed all the way through. However,
while he is telling you that there is a thin

1531.34.text:
line between genius and insanity, just grab
him and hold him down.

1535.66.text:
You can click on any of these films to watch
them. If you are missing the fishing films

1539.40.text:
and the airgun films, watch our new shows,
AirHeads and Fishing Britain. If you have

1543.61.text:
a YouTube film you would like us to pop in
to the weekly top eight, send it in via YouTube

1547.96.text: or email me the link charlie@fieldsportschannel.tv

1552.22.text:
And let's not forget our own shows.In the
latest Fishing Britain, we are chasing rainbows,

1557.27.text:
urban perch, and landlocked salmon. We join
the exciting first day on top reservoir Draycote,

1562.74.text:
working out how to locate some of the 7,000
fresh rainbows that have been stocked. We

1568.00.text:
also get a backstreet view of some of Ant
Glascoe's best perch fishing in central Manchester.

1572.90.text:
We top it off with a trip to the UK's only
landlocked salmon lake. With News and Hooked

1578.95.text:
on YouTube, it's another programme packed
full of angling goodness. Click on the screen

1583.67.text:
to watch it. And do the same for AirHeads.
Our own Prince of Darkness Darren Rogers is

1588.86.text:
ratting and rabbiting with both thermal and
night vision and of course Airguns. Ted of

1594.08.text:
Ted's Holdover says if he would use a high-powered
airgun on big game. Airgun World and Airgunner

1600.26.text:
technical editor Phill Price is out after
corvids, Red squirrel ranger Jerry Moss is

1605.26.text:
showing where to park your nuts in order to
entice squirrels to a shootable position and

1609.66.text:
Captain Back Garden James Marchington
has got trajectile disfunction.

1614.14.text:
Finally, it's Schools Challenge TV week. Excitement
is mounting as the first Schools Challenge

1619.24.text:
clay competition comes closer. Schools are
in training and one of them - TSC sponsor

1624.31.text:
Bredon School - is fielding a full team of
shooters.. We join them in training on Bredon's

1629.48.text:
newly refurbished shooting ground. We are
also visiting outdoor clothing supplier Seeland

1634.10.text:
and we are finding out from top double trap
shooter Stevan Walton what's so great about

1640.73.text:
Well we are back next week and officianados
of what I look like might like to click on

1645.52.text:
this link up here and see what I look like
standing here four years ago. Aged. If you

1651.34.text:
are watching this on Youtube please hit the
subscribe button that is somewhere around

1653.55.text:
the outside of the screen or go to our web
page where you can click to like us on Facebook,

1658.13.text:
follow us on Twitter. This has been Fieldsports
Britain. Good hunting, good shooting, good
